intro: Decalepis arayalpathra, commonly known as the Malabar chestnut, is a small evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Ebenaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are followed by edible, chestnut-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
